headline.main: U.S. Submarine Visits Japan, Sees Horse Races, Sinks 8 Ships; U.S. SUBMARINE VISITS JAPANESE

lead_paragraph: PEARL HARBOR, Hawaii, Nov. 30 -- The new champion submarine skipper on the Pacific, a mild man, so polite that he even called the newspaper men "Sirs," related today an amazing saga of eight Japanese ships sent to the bottom and four others at least badly damaged, all within sight of big Japanese ports.
abstract: Lt Comdr T B Klakring tells how his submarine sank 4 Jap ships, damaged 4, within sight of big Jap ports; to get Navy Cross
